link.synopsis: When family matters call him back home to Summerville from the big city, hot-shot businessman Peter Davis (Casey Payne) soon finds himself beguiled by the small town's slow pace of life, including its peculiar obsession with softball. Peter takes up his mitt and hits the field, but can Summerville's charm -- or lovely local Samantha (Allison Varnes) -- keep him down on the farm for good? Brooks Benjamin directs this charming comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Major League 3: Back to the Minors
Inning by Inning: A Portrait of a Coach
A Player to Be Named Later

link.synopsis: Scrambling for ways to find something in common with a captivatingly beautiful colleague (Erika Walter) who has a mentally challenged sister, ho-hum Jason (Ken Gayton) hires his down-and-out actor pal, Troy (Jason Schaver), to pose as &NFi;his&NFi_; mentally challenged brother. But just how long can the scheming friends keep up their elaborate charade? This independent comedy also stars Adam Breske and Alyssa Roehrenbeck.
link.title: synopsis
How to Make Love to a Woman

link.synopsis: Making their way out west to search for gold, the members of a small rural community experience an awakening and embrace the hippie lifestyle in this groovy 1968 comedy starring Del Close and Garry Goodrow. Once there, they establish a commune and get their fill of sex, drugs and rock 'n' roll while fending off the local cops. Considered lost for 40 years, the film features music from the MC5, Ramblin' Jack Elliot and others.
link.title: synopsis
Live a Little, Love a Little
I Love You, Alice B. Toklas!
Lent in the Month of March
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium
A Guide for the Married Man
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
Dr. Goldfoot and the Girl Bombs
The Knack...and How to Get It
The Three Stooges: The Outlaws Is Coming
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini

link.synopsis: Determined to impress his beautiful girlfriend, Excel (Hailey Birnie), small-town simpleton Dingus McGraw (Kristopher Turner) hatches a scheme to become an Olympic athlete -- much to the chagrin of the town's mayor (Gord Rand), who wants the lovely lass for himself. Now Dingus must take on a beefy Russian wrestler hired by the mayor to crush his dreams of love and Olympic gold. Corey Surge directs this indie comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach

title.regular: The Triumph of Dingus McGraw: Village Idiot

link.synopsis: When he leaves his privileged life as the son of a European despot (Adam West) to attend college in America, young Ratko Volvic (Efren Ramirez) wins friends by partying and throwing cash around like there's no tomorrow. That is, until he meets outspoken co-ed Holly (Katrina Bowden). She confronts Ratko about his autocratic father's abysmal human rights record, causing the libertine to have a change of heart in this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
National Lampoon Presents: One, Two, Many
National Lampoon Presents: The Beach Party at the Threshold of Hell
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise

title.regular: National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son

link.synopsis: Twelve-year-old Lonnie (Sarah Boyd) lives in a wealthy New York neighborhood and is curious upon meeting Karen (Rainbow Harvest), a working-class teen who seems very different from her. The girls begin an unlikely yet meaningful friendship in this wry, tender comedy. Along with Karen's boisterous older brother, the girls spend the summer discovering who they really are. Alyssa Milano co-stars in her feature film debut.
link.title: synopsis
When Zachary Beaver Came to Town
Free Willy 4: Escape from Pirate's Cove

link.synopsis: When he leaves his humble village and moves to the big city of Mumbai to make his way in the world, upstanding citizen Lallan (Rajpal Yadav) proudly takes a job as a security guard -- and soon finds himself facing wild situations far beyond his pay grade. But as his troubles mount, Lallan discovers talents he never knew he had. Dilip Shukla directs this comedy that co-stars Preeti Mehra, Makrand Anaspure and Manoj Joshi.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

title.regular: Hello ... Hum Lallan Bol Rahe Hain
title.short: Hello ... Hum Lallan Bol Rahe Hain

link.synopsis: Scottish comedy hotshot Danny Bhoy, who's made his mark with a quick tongue and bone-dry humor, bundles the brainy and the bawdy in good-natured observational storytelling in this stand-up special recorded at the Montreal Just for Laughs Festival. Count on a transcontinental cultural exchange as the half-Indian comic gets to the ironic point about the economic crisis, body language and other choice head-scratchers in his North American debut.
link.title: synopsis
Aziz Ansari: Intimate Moments for a Sensual Evening
Craig Ferguson: A Wee Bit o' Revolution
Bobby Slayton: Born to Be Bobby
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 1
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
TK Kirkland: Are There Any Questions?
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
Denis Leary and Friends Present: Douchebags & Donuts
Jeff Dunham's Very Special Christmas Special

link.synopsis: Looking for a drummer to play in their low-rent punk band, three handicapped, drugged-out rockers coax high-profile writer Dries (Dries Van Hegen) into joining them -- even though he's never played the drums in his life. But when they hit the road to gear up for a Battle of the Bands competition, Dries exploits the group for his own purposes. Belgium's Koen Mortier directs this graphic, pitch-black comedy based on a novel by Herman Brusselmans.
link.title: synopsis
Otto; or, Up With Dead People
Coffin Joe: At Midnight I'll Take Your Soul
In the Arms of My Enemy

link.synopsis: Bobby Starr (Adam Pascal) is stuck in the past, when he was the adored leader of a famous boy band. Now, Bobby can barely get a gig -- that is, until Rebekka (Amy Davidson) schemes to get him hired to play at the opening of her father's kosher casino in the Catskills. Rebekka is poised to marry a respected rabbi, but her crush on the musical gentile may spark a change of plans. Tovah Feldshuh co-stars in this satirical musical comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Son of Samson / Son of Cleopatra
UFC: The Ultimate 100 Greatest Fights: Vol. 3
That's the Way I Like It

link.synopsis: When a Berlin salon refuses to hire her because of her plump figure, irrepressible hair stylist Kathi König (Gabriela Maria Schmeide) plots to get her revenge by opening up her own beauty parlor right next door to the offending shop. But when she faces an unexpected cash-flow problem, Kathi resorts to some creative means of raising capital. This broad comedy from director Doris Dörrie co-stars Ill-Young Kim and Matthias Freihof.
link.title: synopsis
Our Hitler: A Film from Germany
Schoolgirl Report: Vol. 5: What All Parents Should Know
My Song Goes Round the World
The Return of Dr. Mabuse / The Invisible Dr. Mabuse / The Death Ray Mirror of Dr. Mabuse
In the Dust of the Stars
The Lost Honor of Katharina Blum

link.synopsis: This fiery comedy from director Ferzan Ozpetek finds young Tommaso about to reveal to his large, frenetic Italian family that he's gay. But he's beaten to the punch by his older brother, who is promptly disinherited by their furious father.
link.title: synopsis
Adored: Diary of a Porn Star
My Brother Is an Only Child
Otto; or, Up With Dead People
In the Arms of My Enemy

link.synopsis: A hit in Italy, this genre-bending musical drama satirizes the true story of Tano Guarrasi (Ciccio Guarino), a slain Italian mafioso notorious for his volatile temper and peculiar determination to prevent his four sisters from marrying. As mourners gather for a wake, they offer a mélange of rap songs, dance numbers and comedy bits that suggest Guarrasi's oppressive hand might even reach out from the grave.
link.title: synopsis
Saint John Bosco: Mission to Love
Adored: Diary of a Porn Star
Padre Pio: Between Heaven and Earth

link.synopsis: Studious Dirk (Robert Gwisdek) and carefree Momo (Max Riemelt) leave their small town behind to study economics at Darmstadt Polytech. Although Dirk immediately takes to the rigors of college life, Momo is more interested in partying. His discipline is so lacking that he gets thrown out of his study group, and to make matters worse, he loses money in a bad investment. Director Frieder Wittich makes his feature debut with this German comedy of errors.
link.title: synopsis
Vision: From the Life of Hildegard von Bingen
Schoolgirl Report: Vol. 5: What All Parents Should Know
My Song Goes Round the World

link.synopsis: Pining away in Taipei for his girlfriend who moved to Paris, lovelorn Kai (Jack Yao) gets a break when a shady gangster offers him a free ticket to the City of Light in exchange for delivering a mysterious package. Kai jumps at the chance, but soon finds himself chased by bumbling cops, kidnapped by would-be gangsters and finding true love in an unexpected place. Writer-director Arvin Chen makes his feature film debut with this screwball comedy.
link.title: synopsis
A Woman, a Gun and a Noodle Shop
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage
The Butcher, the Chef and the Swordsman
Love Is a Many Stupid Thing
Who's the Woman, Who's the Man

link.synopsis: Students at Aversham and Cronstall's School for Girls decide to stir up some excitement by offering themselves -- as prom dates -- to the winners of a series of daffy competitions between two rival boys' prep schools in this comedy. The girls are intent on not being taken for granted, and the boys are determined to do whatever it takes to snag the coveted prom rights -- even if it means all-out war between their schools.
link.title: synopsis
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th

link.synopsis: Lacking the courage to ask his wife La Tana (Valeria Bertuccelli) for a divorce, El Tenso (Adrián Suar) hires a professional lothario (Gabriel Goity) to woo her away, hoping she'll be the one to end things once she realizes she's no longer in love with him. Talk about passive-aggressive. Juan Taratuto directs this Spanish-language black comedy about marriage and the absurdity of romantic relationships.
link.title: synopsis
No Dejare Que No Me Quieras
El Lado Oscuro del Corazon II

link.synopsis: In a bid to boost his self-esteem, a hapless futon salesman (Larry Dahlke) vows to take the top prize in a mini marathon and, in the process, defeat a grating co-worker (Chris Stack) in a competitive race for a management position. Neither man is what you'd call a "winner" ... but that doesn't mean a loser can't win. Jeff Stockberger and Michael Sammaciccia co-star in this indie comedy about overcoming occupational obstacles.
link.title: synopsis
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Platinum Comedy Series: Paul Rodriguez: Live in San Quentin
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Platinum Comedy Series: The Torry Brothers: A Family Affair
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son

link.synopsis: When Armaan Ali (Boman Irani) returns to his job after a three-month leave, he tells his angry employer the mother of all fish tales, which begins with finding a husband for his daughter -- and culminates with threatening to collapse the government! The farcical story Ali relates to his boss in this Bollywood comedy is delightful, hilarious and poignant, but the question remains: How much of his compelling story is true?
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: Veteran actor Otto (Henry Hubchen) is drinking too much on the set, irritating his leading lady Bettina and making the director worry that his movie is falling apart. As a backup, the director hires a much younger understudy, a move that doesn't sit well with Otto. It doesn't help the situation that Otto and Bettina have a romantic history and she is now unhappily married to the director in this black comedy about aging, love and liquor.
link.title: synopsis
Vision: From the Life of Hildegard von Bingen
Schoolgirl Report: Vol. 5: What All Parents Should Know
My Song Goes Round the World

link.synopsis: In this sequel to the hit romantic comedy, brash tabloid reporter Ludo Dekker (Til Schweiger) and day-care center manager Anna Gotzlowski (Nora Tschirner) move in together -- and soon find their relationship threatened by misunderstandings and the return of their sexy exes. As Ludo and Anna become mired in jealousies and disappointments, can their love survive the schemes of former flames looking to reignite the fire?
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Join actor James Franco as he takes a documentary film crew behind the scenes at "Saturday Night Live" to chronicle how its writers, cast and guest host John Malkovich gear up to produce an episode of the iconic comedy sketch show. Franco, who has also hosted the show, turns the camera on creator Lorne Michaels, actress Kristen Wiig and other "SNL" luminaries as they work hard to bring the funny to their late-night audience.
link.title: synopsis
Empires: Peter and Paul and the Christian Revolution
Beethoven: The Sound and the Fury
Rameses: Wrath of God or Man?
National Geographic: Blackbeard: Terror At Sea
Slavery and the Making of America
Passport to Europe: England, Ireland & Scotland
ABC News Presents: Pope John Paul II: His Life and Legacy
Voyage to the Planets and Beyond
Saving a Species: Gorillas on the Brink
Decoding the Past: Secrets of the Dollar Bill
NBC News Presents: Secrets to the Code
NBC News Presents: Deep Throat: The Full Story of Watergate
National Geographic: Killer Wave: Power of the Tsunami

link.synopsis: This gleefully audacious, Web-based animated comedy follows the misadventures of Orlando Reed, an enthusiastic pot smoker who inherits a small South Los Angeles coffee shop when its owner up and dies. Through a haze of bong hits, Orlando tries to make a go of the business with the dubious help of his two pals, lesbian homegirl Magda and aspiring hooligan Ponzi -- along with the spirit of the dead owner, now a reincarnated cantankerous cockroach.
link.title: synopsis
Seth MacFarlane's Cavalcade of Cartoon Comedy: Uncensored
Aqua Teen Hunger Force Colon Movie Film for Theaters
National Lampoon Presents Jake's Booty Call
Liquid Tales: The Animated Films of Patrick Smith
Extreme Animation: Films by Phil Mulloy
Spike & Mike's Classic Festival of Animation
The Best of Zagreb Film: Laugh at Your Own Risk & For Children Only
The Nine Lives of Fritz the Cat
Bill's Dirty Shorts: A Collection of Bill Plympton's Naughty Cartoons
Spike & Mike's Sick and Twisted Festival of Animation: Caught in the Act
Spike & Mike's Sick & Twisted Festival of Animation: Contagious
National Lampoon: The Best of the Romp

link.synopsis: This striking compilation of silent shorts features Cholo Chaplin, the "innocent gangster" who wanders through a landscape reminiscent of the Day of the Dead. Laced with both drama and comedy, the shorts are shot in the style of old movie serials. In the short "A Day at the Theatre," Cholo and his son are headed to the movies but end up caught up in a melee surrounding a patriotic Latino soldier being hounded because of his heritage.
link.title: synopsis
Paul Rodriguez's Latin All-Stars of Comedy: Vol. 1
Platinum Comedy Series: Earthquake: About Got Damm Time!
Platinum Comedy Series: Paul Rodriguez: Live in San Quentin
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Desi's Looking for a New Girl
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"

link.synopsis: When their clothes are stolen and mysteriously replaced by Korean military uniforms while they cavort in the ocean, three Japanese school pals find themselves mistaken for illegal immigrants by hyper-patriotic Japanese government officials. As they try to prove their citizenship, the friends face absurd racist attitudes that pervade Japanese society. This comedy from director Nagisa Ôshima stars Norihiko Hashida, Kazuhiko Kato and Osamu Kitayama.
link.title: synopsis
In the Realm of the Senses
The Men Who Tread on the Tiger's Tail
Warm Water Under a Red Bridge
Zatoichi: Vol. 12: Zatoichi and the Chess Expert

link.synopsis: When she reaches the breaking point trying to balance the competing demands of being a devoted mother, a sexy wife and a driven businesswoman, Alice McGrath (Molly Shannon) splits into three distinct personalities -- one for each of her roles. But when her unfettered alter egos start wreaking havoc, the real Alice must regain control and send the imposters packing. Steven Weber co-stars in this made-for-TV comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
The Dr. Jekyll & Mr. Hyde Rock 'N Roll Musical
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Commercial Parodies
Masters of Horror: Dario Argento: Jenifer

link.synopsis: After mob accountant Jonathan Mardukas, aka the Duke, switches loyalties, crime lords everywhere must make sure that he is silenced in this action comedy. It's up to down-on-his luck cop Rockinsky (Stephen Baldwin) to make sure that the Duke lives to testify. Trapped with the injured Duke in a hospital, Rockinsky appeals to his estranged wife, Patricia (Bettina Zimmermann), and a bevy of reluctant hospital staff for help holding off the determined assassins.
link.title: synopsis
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest

link.synopsis: Delivering pizzas in Rio de Janeiro to pay the bills, aspiring photographer and lesbian Elvis (Simone Spoladore) knocks on the door of transvestite Madona (Igor Cotrim), only to find the cross-dressing showgirl distraught at being robbed by a former lover. Soon the two form a tight and loving bond that gives them the courage to follow their dreams no matter the obstacles. Marcelo Laffitte directs this Brazilian romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in Rio
Love for Sale: Suely in the Sky
Blood and Wine: A Brazilian Story
The Other Side of the Street
To the Left of the Father
The Year My Parents Went on Vacation
Coffin Joe: At Midnight I'll Take Your Soul
No Dejare Que No Me Quieras

link.synopsis: To pay his tuition, inept Andy (Scott Ganyo) starts a work-study job preserving ancient artifacts at his college's museum. After he mistakenly allows a prized idol to get stolen, Andy scours the campus braving pagan cults and psycho killers to retrieve it. Full of clever jokes and madcap absurdity, director Guy Davis's kitschy comedy features strong performances, witty dialogue and an intriguing sci-fi storyline.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys

link.synopsis: Jilted by his girlfriend, programmer Lewis Henderson (Tyler Labine) decides to take a different approach to love -- but after Internet porn stops thrilling him, he focuses his ardor on the computers in this deviant romantic comedy. With his boss determined to find out who's been violating the office equipment, Lewis tries to evade suspicion by dating mousy receptionist Jane Fredrickson (Sonja Bennett) ... who turns out to be a bit kinky herself.
link.title: synopsis
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It
How to Make Love to a Woman
The Adventures of Swiss Family Robinson: The Complete Series
Orgies and the Meaning of Life
The Night of the White Pants
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

link.synopsis: On the day he turns 50, Lenny (Barry Hilton) endures a series of devastating setbacks -- including losing his job, his marriage and his youth soccer coaching position. But when he starts training a rural village's soccer team, Lenny finds friendship and a new purpose in life. A heartwarming tale about staying true to one's self, this gentle South African comedy co-stars Russel Savadier, Yule Masiteng, Kathleen Anderson and Catriona Andrew.
link.title: synopsis
El Penalti Mas Largo Del Mundo
Jan Svankmajer: The Ossuary and Other Tales

link.synopsis: After suffering a heart attack, obese Brooklyn bus driver Neil Perota (Carmine Famiglietti) relocates to a trailer in the remote countryside in a last-ditch effort to shed his extra pounds and stop his compulsive overeating. As he battles his inner demons, Neil also tries to help a pal (Michael Aronov) kick his drug habit. Matthew Bonifacio directs this inspirational comedy that dramatizes star Famiglietti's real-life effort to lose weight.
link.title: synopsis
The Prize Winner of Defiance, Ohio
High Roller: The Stu Ungar Story
A Guide to Recognizing Your Saints

link.synopsis: When her best friend, Coca (Elena Iguina), finds herself pregnant after a casual fling, unlucky-in-love drag queen Manuela (Humberto Busto) helps Coca face her disapproving family by embracing a male identity, Manuel, and posing as the baby's father. But things go sideways when Manuela discovers that the baby's real daddy is a regular at the gay club where she works. Raúl Marchand Sánchez directs this screwball comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Ice Blues: A Donald Strachey Mystery

link.synopsis: Stuck in a boring job and a loveless marriage, Yong (Samapon Piyapongsiri) discovers renewed excitement for life after he starts an affair with a sexy co-worker (Benjawan Artner). When his mistress demands he get divorced, Yong concocts a series of silly schemes to drive his wife away. Set in Bangkok, Thailand, this outrageous romantic comedy showcases plenty of side-splitting mishaps and embarrassing moments.
link.title: synopsis
Sexphone and the Girl Next Door
Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives

title.regular: Seven Days to Leave My Wife
title.short: Seven Days to Leave My Wife

link.synopsis: Financially backed by a New York City retailer, Krista (Sonja Henie) enrolls at an upstate university, where she promotes the store's latest fashions by wearing them daily. But when other students start to deride her, Krista fixes on proving her detractors wrong. Roy Del Ruth directs this classic musical comedy that co-stars Richard Greene, Cesar Romero, Buddy Ebsen and the hilarious Joan Davis.
link.title: synopsis
Detective Kitty O'Day / Private Snuffy Smith / Club Paradise
There's No Business Like Show Business
The Strange Love of Martha Ivers
You Can't Take It with You

link.synopsis: After learning that he won't receive any of his deceased father's vast fortune, disgruntled loafer Sunderlal (Sunil Pal) concocts a harebrained scheme to trick his sweet and soon-to-be-wealthy niece, Suman (Sanghmitra), into signing over her impending inheritance. Written and directed by lead actor Pal, this uproarious Bollywood comedy features an astounding 51 stand-up comedians in hilarious roles.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: Ordered to come up with fresh story ideas to boost the ratings of a long-running television series that stars a celebrity diva (Jyoti Gauba), exec Subhrojeet (Sushant Singh) quickly discovers that the show has already used every hackneyed plot twist in the book. Desperate for new ideas, Subhrojeet turns to his eclectic circle of friends for help. This comedy from director Sunanda Mitra also features Hrishitaa Bhatt.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: The enchanted bliss of new love comes to a screeching halt when starry-eyed couple Aman (Anubhav Anand) and Neha (Nandana Sen) take the plunge and introduce their polar-opposite families to one another -- one a free-spirited clan and the other a deeply conformist family. Now the young lovers do everything they can to help their relations find common ground. This comedy from director Ajmal Zaheer Ahmad also stars Anupam Kher and Boman Irani.
link.title: synopsis
Love Ke Liye Kuch Bhi Karega

link.synopsis: Desperate to score some quick cash, foolish slackers Felipe (Danny Martinez) and Vato (Alberto Alvarado) struggle to find legitimate work. As their plans continue to backfire, the unlucky pals stumble into several wacky misadventures involving gang bangers, strippers and weed. Set in the City of Angeles, this off-the-wall Latino comedy also features Arturo Gil, Elena Diaz, Noel Gugliemi and Deadlee.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
The Night of the White Pants

link.synopsis: In a bid to illustrate how fear rules most people's lives, a writer (Fabio De Luigi) crafts a tale of star-crossed lovers (Gianmaria Biancuzzi and Alice Croci) who want to marry, despite their families' -- and their own -- obvious differences in this theatrical foreign-language comedy. Award-winning filmmaker Gabriele Salvatores co-wrote the script with playwright Alessandro Genovesi, upon whose work the film is based.
link.title: synopsis
The Loves and Times of Scaramouche
The Virgo, The Taurus and The Capricorn
Open Letter to the Evening News

link.synopsis: After their children's marriage brings them even closer together, next-door neighbors Eve Hubbard (Eve Arden) and Kaye Buell (Kaye Ballard) specialize in driving their husbands batty and interfering in the newlywed lives of Eve's daughter and Kaye's son. Produced by Desi Arnaz using writers from "I Love Lucy," this wacky domestic comedy series conjures up much of the same madcap spirit as its predecessor.
link.title: synopsis
The Mothers-in-Law: The Complete Series: Disc 1
The Mothers-in-Law: The Complete Series: Disc 2
The Mothers-in-Law: The Complete Series: Disc 3
The Mothers-in-Law: The Complete Series: Disc 4
The Mothers-in-Law: The Complete Series: Disc 5
The Mothers-in-Law: The Complete Series: Disc 6
The Mothers-in-Law: The Complete Series: Disc 7
The Mothers-in-Law: The Complete Series: Bonus Material
The Life of Riley / Our Miss Brooks
Not On Your Nellie: The Complete First Series
The Loretta Young Show: Christina's Children Series
One Day at a Time: Season 1
My Favorite Martian: Time Travelers Favorites
Chico and the Man: TV Favorites

link.synopsis: Thanks to the groundwork laid by his friend, Tot (Jose Manalo), suave Samson (Vic Sotto) scores a date with incredible beauty Paula (Paula Taylor). But just as the couple's relationship starts to blossom, Tot's wish of trading places with his lucky pal suddenly comes true. This Filipino romantic comedy about the many pitfalls of online dating also stars Gina Pareño, Manilyn Reynes and Leo Martinez.
link.title: synopsis
Enteng Kabisote 3: Okay Ka Fairy Ko
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote

link.synopsis: After ruining yet another nanny's life, juvenile hell-raiser Angelina (Ogie Alcasid) successfully manages to get her latest &NFi;yaya,&NFi_; Rosalinda (Michael V.), fired. When terrorists accidentally kidnap Angelina, Rosalinda swallows her pride and sets out to rescue the spoiled brat. But the plot thickens when the kidnappers go after Angelina's parents! Michael Tuviera directs this silly Filipino comedy packed with slapstick shenanigans.
link.title: synopsis
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote
Enteng Kabisote 3: Okay Ka Fairy Ko

title.regular: Yaya & Angelina: The Spoiled Brat Movie
title.short: Yaya & Angelina: The Spoiled Brat Movie

link.synopsis: As a vampire-like aswang no longer willing to eat human flesh, rebellious Eliza (Cristine Reyes) breaks away from her clan seeking independence. But as soon as she finds love with a mere mortal (Vic Sotto), her ravenous cohorts invade her new life, causing pain and destruction. Co-starring Agot Isidro, Dante Rivero and Denise Laurel, this Filipino vampire movie effectively blends elements of romance, suspense and even comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Enteng Kabisote 3: Okay Ka Fairy Ko
All About Love: Ang Sarap Ma-In Love
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote

link.synopsis: With furious Jamaican mobsters hounding them to pay back a huge loan, desperate best buds Dino (Dan DeLuca) and Steven (Kris Arnold) concoct an illegal but potentially lucrative scheme that leads to life-threatening danger, unexpected romance and countless surprises. Co-directed by lead actors Arnold and DeLuca, this madcap comedy also features Natalie Diorio, Brian Sherman and Kate Debelack.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys

link.synopsis: Under constant pressure from her traditional mother to accept an arranged marriage, Indian American girl Beena (Melanie Kannokada) fights for the right to choose her own groom, even if that may be someone completely unexpected -- like James (Andreas Wilson), who's from Sweden. Written and directed by Hassan Zee, this comedy co-stars Jessica Kitchens as Beena's best friend who's perpetually plagued by boy problems.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: This British television miniseries follows the misadventures of Gerd Heidemann (Jonathan Pryce), a German journalist who hopes to revive his flagging career by persuading his magazine to purchase diaries written by Adolf Hitler. After spending millions to acquire the books, Heidemann's publication discovers that they're forgeries -- and bad ones at that. Based on the embarrassing 1983 scandal, this comedy also stars Alexei Sayle.
link.title: synopsis
Catherine Cookson's The Man Who Cried
Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
Edge of Darkness: The Complete Series
The Catherine Cookson Anthology: The Tide of Life
A Dance to the Music of Time

link.synopsis: Bored boarding school boys Brad (Bryan Genesse), Steve (Lance Van Der Kolk), Hugh (Alan Deveau) and Marvin (Jason Warren) compete for the ladies in this ribald teen comedy. Raunchy jokes mix with screwball antics as the four pals try to score with women, earning points for each successful seduction. But when they go after 100-pointer Mona Lott, the new French teacher, the guys wind up on the bad side of the school principal (Mike McDonald).
link.title: synopsis
Kitten in a Cage / The Girl from Pussycat
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
See No Evil, Hear No Evil

link.synopsis: To save her successful hair salon and protect her quaint town from overdevelopment, Scottish-born small business owner Lizzie (Corinna May) enthusiastically joins forces with her loyal stylists, local citizens and a charming antique dealer (Richard Bekins). Inspired by events from writer Elizabeth Christensen's life, this cute romantic comedy also stars Vincent Pastore, Lawton Paseka and Peter McRobbie.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
How to Go Out on a Date in Queens

link.synopsis: While attempting to write a groundbreaking novel in contemporary South Africa, struggling scribe Rob battles false criminal charges, grows close to an artsy bank teller and watches his life turn upside down, thanks to a winning lottery ticket. This dark comedy -- South Africa's first feature-length animated film -- blends humor with serious drama to explore the nation's struggles with crime, poverty and prejudice.
link.title: synopsis
Bab'Aziz: The Prince Who Contemplated His Soul
Great African Films: Vol. 2: Sia, the Dream of the Python
Wijdan: The Mystery of Gnawa Trance Music
Great African Films: Vol. 1: Faraw! Mother of the Dunes

link.synopsis: It's slapstick comedy shorts and features galore as comedian Paul Garner -- aka "The Grand Old Man of Vaudeville" -- hosts a hilarious and interesting look at Larry, Moe and Curly in routines filmed in color in 1965. The famed trio's misadventures always seem to land them in trouble, but it is entertaining trouble.
link.title: synopsis
The Three Stooges: The Outlaws Is Coming
The Three Stooges Go Around the World in a Daze
Snow White and the Three Stooges
The Three Stooges: Cops and Robbers
The Three Stooges: All Time Favorites
The Three Stooges: Three Smart Saps
The Three Stooges: Three Stooges in History
The Three Stooges: Soup to Nuts
The Three Stooges 75th Anniversary Edition: Tales from the Three Stooges Vol. 1
The Three Stooges: Stop, Look and Laugh
The Three Stooges: All the World's a Stooge
The Three Stooges: Healthy, Wealthy and Dumb
The Three Stooges: Nutty but Nice
The Three Stooges: Goofs on the Loose
Three Stooges: Stooges and the Law
The Three Stooges: Meet the Baron / Gold Raiders
The Three Stooges 75th Anniversary Edition: Tales from the Three Stooges Vol. 2
The Three Stooges: Stooged and Confoosed
It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World
The Return of the Pink Panther

title.regular: The Three Stooges 75th Anniversary Edition: Tales from the Three Stooges Vol. 3

link.synopsis: On his third date with Kathy (Annette O'Toole), a newly jobless David (Martin Short) is so determined to impress her that he borrows a friend's apartment and pretends that it belongs to him. Meanwhile, Kathy has been less-than honest about the existence of her 7-year-old daughter. Paul Reiser and Joanna Kerns co-star in this engaging romantic comedy about modern relationships -- and their painful realities.
link.title: synopsis
Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears

link.synopsis: Convinced that only true love can put a stop to his epic streak of rotten luck, London casino "cooler" Arush (Akshay Kumar) agrees to a sudden marriage with the secretive but lovely Devikah (Jiah Khan) and immediately his fortunes appear to change. But when he meets his real soul mate, Sandy (Deepika Padukone), while honeymooning with his new bride, Arush discovers his troubles have just begun. Sajid Khan directs this romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: The first season of this romantic comedy series follows the misadventures of sexy singles Annie (Becki Newton) and Frannie (Jordana Spiro) as they navigate the vagaries of 21st-century dating -- even as all their other pals happily settle down into married bliss. Though cheery Annie and cynical Frannie don't always see eye to eye, their shared experiences shed a unique light on the mysteries of sex, love and modern relationships.
link.title: synopsis
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
The Second City: The First Family of Comedy
The Loretta Young Show: Christina's Children Series
Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series
The Best of So Graham Norton
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Hercules Against the Moon Men
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Killer Shrews
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Prince of Space
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Barugon
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Gaos
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Guiron
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Zigra
The Jack Benny Show: Collector's Edition
America's Funniest Home Videos: Salute to Romance

link.synopsis: While faithfully following all of the advice his inner voice recommends, an awkward loser (Joe Kraemer) encounters friction with his girlfriend (Ele Keats), experiences one horrendous setback after another and struggles to stay upbeat. Written and directed by Heidi Van Lier, this charming experimental comedy features a soundtrack full of catchy pop tunes and relies on voice-over narration instead of dialogue.
link.title: synopsis
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home

link.synopsis: Tired of being teased about the birthmark on his face and his loser life, Rudolph (Byron Lane) posts to the Internet his rant-and-rave videos that no one watches -- until his quirky cousin (Ahna O'Reilly) edits them to attract the hip online crowd. The videos go viral, and Rudolph discovers popularity isn't all it's cracked up to be. Nathaniel Atcheson directs this award-winning unconventional comedy that co-stars Beth Grant and Octavia Spencer.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys

link.synopsis: When a minor TV actor (Louis Puopolo) sees starry-eyed Vermont gal Valerie (Sybil Kempson) rehearsing in a small-town theater and offers her a part in his off-Broadway play, she impulsively leaves her fiance (Andrew Hernin) and sister (Wendy Lawrence) to chase her acting dream in the Big Apple. But when the gig falls through, Valerie is reduced to a series of humiliating jobs to make ends meet. Debra Eisenstadt directs this independent comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: After realizing that they both recently visited the same seaside town, a movie director (Sang-kyung Kim) and his film critic friend (Jun-Sang Yu) recount the romantic highlights of their trips, unaware that they were there at the exact same time and met the same people. Winner of the Cannes Film Festival's Un Certain Regard showcase, Korean director Sang-soo Hong's playful comedy also stars So-ri Moon.
link.title: synopsis
The Virgin Stripped Bare by Her Bachelors
Woman Is the Future of Man
I Really, Really Like You: Vol. 2

link.synopsis: It's bliss to witness life after death -- until the resurrected loved one you thought you couldn't live without starts jonesing for human flesh. Now, with zombies on the prowl, it's up to three newly minted ninjas to save the planet. Daniel Ross, Cory Okouchi and P.J. Megaw co-star in this independent horror comedy from writer-director Justin Timpane that blends elements of several different genres.
link.title: synopsis
Poultrygeist: Night of the Chicken Dead
Zombies vs. Satan: Meat for Satan's Icebox / Wiseguys vs. Zombies
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!

link.synopsis: When an annoying distant relative (Paresh Rawal) shows up unannounced and quickly becomes the worst houseguest ever, screenwriter Puneet (Ajay Devgan) and his wife, Munmun (Konkona Sen Sharma), reach their wits' end and begin implementing increasingly crazy schemes intended to scare him away. Directed by Ashwani Dheer, this wacky Bollywood comedy also stars Satish Kaushik, Bikramjeet Kanwarpal and Akhilendra Mishra.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: Actor, fitness coach and pinup guy Ronnie Kerr draws on all facets of his far-flung career for this charming autobiographical tale about 35-year-old Ben (Kerr), who finally meets Mr. Right (Scott Gabelein) -- and then discovers how much they don't have in common. Director Devin Hamilton touches on monogamy and other related lifestyle issues in this playful comedy about relationship building in the contemporary world.
link.title: synopsis
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
The Ultimate Lesbian Short Film Festival
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack

link.synopsis: Six neurotic, sex-obsessed thirtysomethings share pointed barbs, romantic musings, relationship advice and (occasionally) passion in this award-winning British comedy that features a strong ensemble cast.
link.title: synopsis
The Worst Week of My Life
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
Tim & Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!

link.synopsis: With an impressive lineup of quirky characters, including troubled teenager Vicky, clueless caregiver Lou, plus-sized female Bubbles and hotel manager Ray, this popular sketch comedy show cleverly pokes fun at all sectors of society.
link.title: synopsis
A Bit of Fry and Laurie
French & Saunders: Back with a Vengeance
The Worst Week of My Life
Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series
The Life and Times of Vivienne Vyle
Full Bottom: Not Another Half-Arsed Release
The Hard Times of RJ Berger
The League of Gentlemen: Christmas Special
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 1
Tim & Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Saturday TV Funhouse
South Park: The Passion of the Jew
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
South Park: A Very Buttery Collection
South Park: The Cult of Cartman

link.synopsis: Lost in deep space aboard the gigantic mining ship &NFi;Red Dwarf&NFi_;, hopelessly lazy technician Dave (Craig Charles), the last human left in the entire universe, attempts to find a way back to Earth with his dead crewmate's hologram (Chris Barrie) and a feline life-form (Danny John-Jules) by his side. Throughout this BBC sci-fi comedy series and cult favorite, the gang encounters strange aliens, time distortions, mutant diseases and more.
link.title: synopsis
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Full Bottom: Not Another Half-Arsed Release
A Bit of Fry and Laurie
Doctor Who: The Waters of Mars
Doctor Who: The End of Time
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Attack of the Giant Leeches
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Crawling Eye
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Ring of Terror
Mystery Science Theater 3000: First Spaceship on Venus
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Manhunt in Space
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Prince of Space
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Monster a Go-Go
Doctor Who: The Trial of a Time Lord
Futurama: Into the Wild Green Yonder
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Teenagers from Outer Space
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Giant Gila Monster
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Secret Agent, Super Dragon
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Santa Claus Conquers the Martians
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Night of the Blood Beast

link.synopsis: When a boisterous woman named Geraldine (Dawn French) becomes their new vicar, the dumbfounded residents of the conservative English village of Dibley have a fit. But with her sharp wit and tender compassion, Geraldine slowly wins the hearts of all those who doubted her. This popular British comedy series co-stars Gary Waldhorn as parish council chairman David and James Fleet as David's polar-opposite son, Hugo.
link.title: synopsis
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
The Vicar of Dibley: A Holy Wholly Happy Ending
French & Saunders: Gentlemen Prefer French & Saunders
French & Saunders: Living in a Material World
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
French & Saunders: Back with a Vengeance
Are You Being Served?: The Movie
To the Manor Born: Silver Wedding Anniversary
The Worst Week of My Life
The Best of The Steve Harvey Show
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Santa Claus Conquers the Martians
The League of Gentlemen: Christmas Special

link.synopsis: At Bayview Retirement Village, elderly partners in crime Tom (Graham Crowden) and Diana (Stephanie Cole) fight for better living conditions by complaining about new problems, creating havoc every chance they get and persistently tormenting obnoxious manager Harvey (Daniel Hill). Throughout this British comedy series, Tom enjoys visits with his son Geoffrey (Andrew Tourell), and Diana clashes with Harvey's doting assistant Jane (Janine Duvitski).
link.title: synopsis
Are You Being Served? Again: The Complete Series
To the Manor Born: Silver Wedding Anniversary
As Time Goes By: Reunion Specials
Open All Hours: The Complete Series
Are You Being Served?: The Movie
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
Keeping Up Appearances: Life Lessons from Onslow
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Final Sacrifice
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Santa Claus Conquers the Martians

link.synopsis: In this black comedy, oddball artist Viscount Laris (Dan Zukovic) becomes entangled with beguiling cosmetician Juxta (Sarah Strange) and joins her in a project to manipulate the life of Ed Smith (Kurt Max Runte), a hapless graphic designer, through a series of cleverly staged events. But when Juxta unexpectedly falls for Ed, sentiments among the odd triangle of personalities become even more complicated and ominous.
link.title: synopsis
The Loss of a Teardrop Diamond
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail

link.synopsis: When he discovers that hapless Younggu (director Hyung-rae Shim, reprising his popular Korean TV character) may be his illegitimate son, an aging American mob boss decides to groom the blundering lad to succeed him as the family's next godfather. But with Younggu holding the reigns of power, organized crime may soon descend into full-blown chaos. Harvey Keitel, Jason Mewes and Jocelin Donahue co-star in this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son

link.synopsis: When ownership of Bazooka's Gym passes to them after their father's unexpected demise, brothers Angus and Judah Bazooka (Vinny Duwe and Sean R. Brooks) lock horns over the future of the business and the fate of the lusty, busty women who work there. While Judah resorts to dirty tricks, Angus tries to tempt prospective customers with titillating new classes. Michael G. Leonard directs this raunchy independent comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son
Ryan and Sean's Not So Excellent Adventure
Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: Spanning more than three centuries of European history, this irreverent comedy traces the extraordinary story of seven priceless pearls as they pass through the hands of such renowned figures as François I, Napoleon III, and Mary, Queen of Scots. With total disregard for historical accuracy, the film features writer-director Sacha Guitry playing four different roles and leading lady Jacqueline Delubac interpreting three.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Passion, infidelity and uncontrollable jealousy dominate this dialogue-driven romantic comedy, which centers on the complicated relationships between a magazine editor (Sacha Guitry), his longtime girlfriend, a dashing movie star (Georges Grey) and an astute reporter (Jacqueline Delubac). Remade decades later by Valérie Lemercier, this tale about urban sophisticates demonstrates writer, director and leading man Guitry's impressive way with words.
link.title: synopsis
The Beat That My Heart Skipped
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: While throwing back a few beers, buddies Leroy (Rob Benedict), Victor (Aaron Paul), Mason (Christopher Gessner) and Bernard (David Monahan) recount their humiliating struggles with the opposite sex, spilling intimate details about erotic escapades, infidelities and knuckleheaded blunders. Writer-director David VonAllmen's raunchy comedy -- his feature film debut -- co-stars Smith Cho, Shannon Lucio, Carly Pope and Jennifer Gillian.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

link.synopsis: In 1962 Mexico City, precocious Emma (Sofía Espinosa) is hovering on the edge of adolescence and coping with a difficult family situation when her changing figure leads her to the conclusion that breasts are the center of the universe. After Emma's sister departs for college, leaving her alone with their quarreling parents, Emma begins to attract the attention of boys and starts a campaign to get her first bra in this quirky coming-of-age comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Crypt of Terror: Horror from South of the Border: Vol. 1
Wait for Me in Another World

link.synopsis: Veteran comedian and actor Kevin Pollak is known as much for his impressions of fellow actors as for his roles alongside them in &NFi;The Usual Suspects&NFi_; and &NFi;Casino&NFi_;, and this stand-up special showcases Pollak's seamless ability to slip into character. Drawing on experiences acquired on and off set, the performer, rated among Comedy Central's Top 100 Comedians of All Time, puts a wry spin on tales of a life of close encounters.
link.title: synopsis
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Platinum Comedy Series: The Torry Brothers: A Family Affair
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special
Frank Caliendo: All Over the Place
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
Denis Leary and Friends Present: Douchebags & Donuts
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Bobby Slayton: Born to Be Bobby
George Carlin: Jammin' in New York

link.synopsis: Dreaming of becoming a famous actor like Richard Gere in order to bring greater attention to the plight of his native land, spirited teen Nyima sets his sights on winning a drama competition for Tibetan-born youth living in exile in India. But soon Nyima and his pals find themselves embroiled in romantic entanglements that threaten to run Nyima's plans off the rails. Tashi Wangchuk and Tsultrim Dorjee direct this warmhearted romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
The Boys and Girl from County Clare

link.synopsis: A phone is a dangerous weapon in Yankerville, where over the top puppet personalities such as loud-mouthed politician Tony, boisterous radio deejay The Nudge and long-winded old-timer Elmer pull off elaborate prank phone calls on real life victims. This Comedy Central series features a star-studded cast of talented improv comedians including Tracy Morgan, Sarah Silverman, Jimmy Kimmel and Wanda Sykes.
link.title: synopsis
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!
The Man Show Boy / Household Hints from Adult Film Stars
Lewis Black's Root of All Evil
Seth MacFarlane's Cavalcade of Cartoon Comedy: Uncensored
Kathy Griffin: My Life on the D-List
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Jimmy Fallon
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dana Carvey
Tim & Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!
The League of Gentlemen: Christmas Special
The Man Show Presents: Girls on Trampolines
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Saturday TV Funhouse
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Eddie Murphy
The Hard Times of RJ Berger
Married... with Children: The Most Outrageous Episodes: Vol. 2
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
South Park: The Passion of the Jew

link.synopsis: Darren Trumeter, Sam Brown, Trevor Moore, Zach Cregger and Timmy Williams bring the laughs with fresh parodies and recurring characters -- such as The Boss and Jerry Bronham (both Moore) and Abraham Lincoln (Cregger) -- in this sketch comedy show. Other characters include Billy Matherson, Satan, and Caleb, who's usually in trouble; and skits touch on history, stereotypes, relationships, religion and more.
link.title: synopsis
The Hard Times of RJ Berger
How to Be a Serial Killer
South Park: A Very Buttery Collection
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 2
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Christopher Walken
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Commercial Parodies

link.synopsis: Ninjas, pirates, mutants and disco collide in this bizarre comedy, which follows intrepid hero and ladies man Kung Fu Joe (Zak VanWinkle) as he reluctantly teams with his former nemesis (Jeremy Parrish) to derail a sneaky mad scientist (David Neevel). Written and directed by Glen Berry, this fun-filled flick co-stars Victoria Maurette as a mysterious femme fatale and Alan Shore as Joe's sage master.
link.title: synopsis
Surge of Power: The Stuff of Heroes
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
What's the Worst That Could Happen?
Dr. Goldfoot and the Bikini Machine
Dr. Goldfoot and the Girl Bombs
Freezer Burn: The Invasion of Laxdale

link.synopsis: In this rock 'n' roll comedy that's "more or less based on the real facts," members of a once-famous Mexican band (including director and co-writer Sergio Arau) decide to reunite 20 years after a bitter argument in the back of a taxi pushed them apart. Botellita de Jerez is back, thanks to a hardworking detective who tracked them down. But the band hasn't completely settled old scores. Will they live to rock again?
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: With ratings in the tank, idealistic television host Rafflesia's (Jerrica Lai) bosses insist that she change her highbrow show's content to something more sensational -- namely, interviews with people on their deathbeds. Meanwhile, Rafflesia's would-be boyfriend (Peter Davis) risks losing his job unless he can make his new invention &NFi;less&NFi_; reliable. Will the pair sell out their principles for cash? Yeo Joon Han directs this musical comedy.
link.title: synopsis
That's the Way I Like It
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote
Sexphone and the Girl Next Door
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: This dark comedy examines the lives of four discontented thirtysomethings during a long night of soul-searching about love, sex and the meaning of life after one of their friends is found dead at the party they're all attending. While Nora and Ken (Anna Gutto and Nick Stevenson) dissect their troubled marriage, Marc (Adam Henry Garcia) complains about his own family and Veronica (director Marta Mondelli) ponders her adventures abroad.
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
He's Just Not That Into You
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?

link.synopsis: Disgruntled fast-food employee Joe (DJ Qualls) has had it up to here with flipping burgers, so he's flipping his boss (William Sadler) the bird, metaphorically speaking. But instead of sticking to his brilliant revenge plan, Joe kidnaps a beautiful girl (Nikki Reed) who catches his eye. Now, both he and his hostage are in for an adventure they didn't see coming. Director Vlad Yudin also writes and produces this quirky road comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay
Tales from the Crypt: Demon Knight

link.synopsis: When his co-worker (Qiwen Hong) dies unexpectedly after a spirited night of carousing, a dependable construction worker (Benshan Zhao) carries out the man's dying wish to have his body buried more than 600 miles away in China's Three Gorges region. But holding up his end of the bargain means making the trek with the dead man's body on his back. Some of China's best-known character actors co-star in this quirky comedy inspired by a true story.
link.title: synopsis
A Woman, a Gun and a Noodle Shop
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage
My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro
A Post in White Birch Forest

link.synopsis: In Brooklyn's hipster mecca of Williamsburg, self-important artists including a writer (Penny Bittone), a painter (Russ Russo) and a budding filmmaker (Evertz Israel Saenz-Perez) passionately pursue their lofty dreams while struggling to achieve the success they crave. With striking black-and-white imagery, this noir comedy from director Brad Saville interweaves the stories of seven complex characters to create a rich tapestry of emotions.
link.title: synopsis
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home

link.synopsis: After an unforgettable one-night stand, struggling painter Dustin (Woody Harrelson) can't get the beautiful stranger (Ely Pouget) he slept with out of his mind, so he sets out on an impossible mission to find the irresistible mystery woman and win her heart. A romantic comedy about love, sex and inspiration, the film co-stars Hank Azaria as Dustin's closest friend, Buzz, and features a cameo by Sean Penn.
link.title: synopsis
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human

link.synopsis: In this comedy caper about a bank heist that nets more trouble than the crooks can handle, corrupt lawyer Victor Scalia (Andrew Stevens) leads his hand-picked band of former clients to a clear getaway -- with highly sought-after loot. Realizing that the booty contains a top-secret microchip, the gang tries to return the goods, but with ruthless foreign agents in relentless pursuit, these crooks can't even get arrested.
link.title: synopsis
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
Harry and Walter Go to New York

link.synopsis: An up-and-coming funny guy finds as well as creates ways to bolster his comedy career in this film from Israeli comedian Yehuda Barkan, who writes, directs and stars. Menahem Zilberman, Moshe Timor, Edit Punk and Tzvi Shissel also make appearances. Barkan is known for films such as Bo Nefotzetz Million, Malkat Hakvish, Attack at Dawn, He Walked Through the Fields, Hayeh Ahaltah Otah and Mehapeset Baal Al Arba.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Valerie Harper stars in this made-for-TV comedy as Nora Cromwell, a successful marketing executive who re-examines her priorities and decides to quit her job so she can spend more time with her husband, Jack (Wayne Rogers), and two children (Danny Gerard and Alyson Court). The trouble is, they're not all that happy about having her around. Carol Kane co-stars as Nora's supportive best friend, Maxine.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family
How the Garcia Girls Spent Their Summer
Mo'Nique: I Coulda Been Your Cellmate!

link.synopsis: This 1984 comedy revels in the atypical reactions of an average couple, George (Greg Mullavey) and Martha (Meredith MacRae), to the extreme nosiness of Harvey (Garrett Morris), an obnoxious census taker whose persistence prompts even the most patient citizen to take extreme action. Overwhelmed by Harvey's increasingly impertinent questions, George and Martha kill him, after which they frantically try to hide his body from a quirky detective.
link.title: synopsis
Sherlock Holmes: The Hound of the Baskervilles
In Defense of a Married Man

link.synopsis: Unaware that she's in possession of top-secret documents, beautiful model Barbara (Deborah Raffin) panics when scary government agents start to pursue her. Although she can't stand him, Barbara flees for safety with Russ (Jeff Conaway), a medical student who's madly in love with her. Crazy car chases, gleeful gags and whole lot of Elvis impersonators fill this espionage-themed romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
If It's Tuesday, It Still Must be Belgium
The Man with One Red Shoe
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
The Man Who Knew Too Little
Dr. Goldfoot and the Girl Bombs

link.synopsis: When he chances upon a woman of rare beauty in a picturesque little Italian café, a geeky young man falls head over heels and resolves to win her heart, even though he knows she's way out of his league. But the love-struck lad is going to need every ounce of his resolve as he tries one scheme after another to soften the lady's hard heart. Andy Luotto and Mirella D'Angelo star in this charming romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Loves and Times of Scaramouche
Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears

link.synopsis: Set in late 1960s Israel, this drama tells the tale of two insurance brokers who -- along with their offspring -- are vying for the same client. Although the groups' goals are the same, their tactics are not, and their negotiations take many forms. Once sexual politics enters the mix, the clash between traditional Israel culture and the more liberated attitudes of a younger generation creates additional confusion and comedy.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?
Turn Left at the End of the World

link.synopsis: His home slated to be bulldozed, his business in trouble and his daughter poised to leave the nest with her wealthy fiancé, small-time Tel Aviv junk dealer Lupo (Yehuda Barkan) still finds the courage to keep his life, and his pride, intact. But as he fights overeager housing authorities and charms his daughter's future in-laws, he finds himself the romantic target of an outspoken local widow. Menahem Golan directs this warmhearted comedy.
link.title: synopsis
A Year of the Quiet Sun

link.synopsis: Eva (Iris Berben) is the object of rich Sugar Daddy's (János Gönczöl) affection. But while he showers her with gifts, she wants someone younger -- namely Erich (Jochen Richter), who's more her style. Learning that Eva has left, Sugar Daddy sends his chauffeur, Theo (Mogens von Gadow), to find her and Erich. What results is a hilarious pursuit that turns this romantic comedy into a slapstick free-for-all.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?
The Loves and Times of Scaramouche
The BRD Trilogy: The Marriage of Maria Braun

link.synopsis: To keep her ancestral home from falling apart, a marquise (Madeleine Renaud) turns the place into an inn. Slow business threatens the house once again, until bank robber César Maricorne (Yves Montand) and his two dopey partners happen by. They hope to lay low at the inn, unaware that the proprietors will kill for the stolen cash. One hilariously failed murder attempt follows another in this comedy that co-stars Maria Schell and Jean Rochefort.
link.title: synopsis
Jean de Florette / Manon of the Spring
The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie
The Diving Bell and the Butterfly

link.synopsis: A triptych of witty Noel Coward plays, this classic comedy chronicles a bickering vaudeville duo on the verge of splitting up, one man's (Stanley Holloway) troubles with his annoying family and a pair of full-time house guests who always overstay their welcome. When this last couple decides to relocate from the French Riviera to Venice, they cunningly attempt to relieve their wealthy hostess of her substantial gambling winnings.
link.title: synopsis
The Man in the White Suit
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story

link.synopsis: With their theatrical troupe on the verge of going bankrupt, struggling performers Arthur (Arthur Askey) and Stinker (Richard Murdoch) become the servants of wealthy aristocrat Lady Randall (Lily Morris), a former entertainer whom they push to bankroll their latest production. Directed by Marcel Varnel, this classic comedy features hilarious instances of mistaken identity as well as a dazzling finale.
link.title: synopsis
The Ealing Comedy Collection: Whisky Galore
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different
The Knack...and How to Get It

link.synopsis: In this comedy adventure period piece based on the story by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, a boisterous French hussar and womanizer, Col. Etienne Girard (Peter McEnery), falls for a noblewoman during Napoleon's (Eli Wallach) campaign in the Spanish peninsula. His affair with the enticing Countess Teresa (Claudia Cardinale), who's spying for the British against Napoleon, puts Girard at odds with his duties as she tries to enlist him for her cause.
link.title: synopsis
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
The Russians Are Coming, The Russians Are Coming
Once Upon a Time in the West
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different

link.synopsis: As the head honcho of a vibrant African American parish, Pastor Jones (Jean-Claude La Marre) works hard to keep his opinionated congregation happy, set aside enough quality time with his family and live the way the God wants. In the first season of this inspiring comedy series, Pastor Jones runs into huge headaches with his ex-girlfriend (Vivica A. Fox), who desperately wants to get back together even though he's married.
link.title: synopsis
Pastor Jones 2: Help Save My Daughter
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
The Funny World of Lucy: Vol. 2
Black Woman's Guide to Finding a Good Man
The Loretta Young Show: Christina's Children Series
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
The Jack Benny Show: Collector's Edition

link.synopsis: In this goofy sports saga, an amateur hockey team composed of a cast of losers is so bad that they have no choice but to disband completely after one final weekend tournament -- no other team will even agree to play them. The disgraced men face a choice: whether to go out as the losers everyone thinks they are or make one final statement. Plenty of collision-filled rink action and hockey humor keep the slapstick comedy flowing throughout.
link.title: synopsis
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
The Night of the White Pants
Frank Caliendo: All Over the Place
